name: Ibis Warszawa Stare Miasto - Old Town

reviews.title: Great Location - Ibis Warsaw Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Terrific property, highly recommended.

likes.liked: — Location, cleanliness, service and modern design of rooms.
likes.disliked: — The property is somewhat isolated from any other hotels or restaurants.

reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 day stay at this hotel. The room was excellent - very quiet. The breakfast is great. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location of this hotel is superb. About a 15 minute walk to the Old Town. There is a bus/tram stop right outside the hotel and if you buy a pass you can zap around the city without any difficulty. Very impressed with Warsaw. Very clean city saw no litter whatsoever. The people are friendly and they live with the snow - life carries on as normal with every road/footpath being clear. Flew with Wizzair - completely full flights and first rate.
reviews.title: Highly recommend the Ibis Warszawa Old Town (Stare Miasto).

reviews.text: My wife and I wanted to be staying in the Old Town section of Warsaw and the Ibis was as close as we could find. As it turns out there really aren't many properties in the Old Town proper but this hotel is located a leisurely fifteen minutes away by foot and is a great property. It is relatively new, very modern and kept up very well. While our room was compact it was well designed, the bath was very comfortable and most importantly, the room was quiet and clean. The service at the front desk was terrific and we certainly felt as if we were in a very upscale property despite the low price. We couldn't have been happier.
reviews.title: Outstanding value

reviews.text: There are a number of buses that stop right outside the door but we never had an opportunity to take one as the walk into the Old Town area was quick and easy taking you past the Department of Justice, the Chinese Embassy and other imposing buildings that we weren't able to identify. While we were there there was a dedication of some type of war memorial in front of the hotel; we were never able to exactly ascertain what that was about but with the veterans in uniform and the candles that stayed lit through the night it was an impressive sight.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good economy hotel located relatively near the old and new town. Excellent public transport links to the rest of the city by tram/bus. Comfortable, quiet rooms which are quite large. Breakfast buffet is very good. There was no running water at the hotel on arrival (due to roadworks outside) but staff made no effort to inform us of the problem, keep us posted as to when to expect water and didn't seem to manage the problem well at all. Many complaints from other customers. As this is a one-off, i'd reccommend the hotel for location and price but the staff aren't particularly friendly or informative.
reviews.title: affordable, average, good location

reviews.text: We stayed at this Ibis in August of 2007. Below are comments on various aspects of the stay:
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect--we enjoyed our stay
Not bad hotel - staff not nice at all
reviews.text: Location: Pretty good. It's about a 8 minute walk to the New Town, which is nice, and then Old town is just 5 minutes from that. You walk for maybe 5 minutes from the hotel down a main street, and then go a few minutes down a side street, and you're where you need to be. We walked back by ourselves many nights at 11 pm or 12 and felt perfectly safe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff: A + here. As two Americans who don't speak Polish and are not experienced travelers, we needed a lot of help. They were nice to us each and every time we asked a question, which was often. They all spoke good english. There was a problem with our reservation when we checked in (not their fault, we had booked through an academic conference who had messed things up). It was a weekend so the hotel couldn't get ahold of the organization, but they told us to just enjoy our weekend and they'd take care of things on Monday.
reviews.title: OK if you like a business hotel with other comments
to every one that wants a cheap but clean hotel in warsaw.
reviews.text: Internet: There is a computer in the lobby you can use, but I believe it was rather pricy. I'm still not sure how the wireless worked. We were told that only some rooms had access, and that ours didn't, but when we got to our room, we were able to connect to the Orange network. You have to buy a card to use at the front desk. It came to about $4.00 /hour. If you can't get the wireless in your room, you can use your laptop in the lobby.

aka: Ibis Warszawa Stare Miasto Hotel Warsaw
description: The Ibis Warszawa Stare Miasto hotel is located close to the old city of Warsaw and the Royal Palace. Only 12 km from Okecie international airport and 3 km from the railway station, it is ideal for weekends and longer explorations of the Polish capital. It proposes 333 air-conditioned rooms, a restaurant, a bar serving snacks 24/24, private covered parking and 6 meeting rooms for organising seminars and conferences. Wifi wireless Internet access for guests on a business trip.
